intro: Clematis transiens, commonly known as the transitory clematis, is a deciduous vine native to the eastern United States. It is characterized by its rapid growth and ability to climb using its twining stems. The plant produces showy, fragrant flowers in shades of white, pink, and purple during the spring. Its leaves are compound, typically consisting of three to five leaflets, and are alternate along the stem. Clematis transiens is relatively low-maintenance but requires well-drained soil and full sun to thrive.
